intro: Pleconax conoidea, commonly known as the conical pleconax, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique conical-shaped inflorescence. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of red and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
